column5: Well after weeks of sending resume's, returning phone calls and running up long distance minutes, I have finally gotten an offer from Halley's Camps to be a fishing guide.  So if you are planning a trip to Halley's this summer....ASK FOR ME!!! haha at least introduce yourself anyways so that I can meet some of the great people here on OFC.  Anyways, just thought I would share...and I am looking forward to hopefully meeting some of you this summer.  Till next time,  Hawk
....Wow sounds like my dream job, oh well I'll least be able to read your reports at some point. Congratulations, sounds like you're in for a fantastic summer.
Welcome to the club lol  What species are in the lake? and do you have a link to their website?  -R-
Congratulations!  Sounds like a sweet job to me.
Congratulations there young'N It'll be a summer you'll remember for the rest of your life. I hope it is successful for you and that it become, All you hope it to be. Be careful out there. bNb
You can find them HERE! RO. Looks like a good outfit. I'm sure you'll have a great summer. Don't forget the reports!
congrats buddy!!  you will love it.  guiding is the best job ive ever had and ive had lots.  enjoy the season.
good job bud you might want to change your avatar to a much more impressive fish now that you have a reputation to keep up.  Have a good summer with it.  Art
Guiding changed my life for the better in more ways then 1.  Hope you have a great summer.  I can't wait to get back up to NW Ont. myself for another season.
Congrats and it looks like a great place. Hope you enjoy the summer there.
Congrats!!!
Get those pike inches for the tournament!
congrats,sounds good
Look like a great place to be to put some very respectible fish in the boat.   Congratulations.
i'm assuming your new job includes discounts and benefits for board members
Nice! Sounds like a great job!
Congrats on the job! So which outpost are you gonna be at doing the grunt work? Looks like they have a few spots...
Congratulations!!!  Hope you have a great experience
Congrads, I hope it goes well for you!

Oh yeah, forgot to add my best advice for any new guide.... spend the money on a Gor-Tex rain suit, it's the best investment you can make towards your new job.  You'll spend FULL DAYS in the rain and you'll be an unhappy guide if you are soaked to the bone.  My Bass Pro Shops 100MPH suit has served me well and is far dryer then my colleague's Cabela's Guide Wear suits, which all leak in the crotch area, esp. if you're sitting.  Good luck with your new job!

Best of luck bud.Take a page from JP(Dip Lip)book and take lots of picks and post reports.The customers will love you and you may get a gig writing for magazines.Some of the best reports here were from when he was guiding a couple of years ago.Best of luck. Joe
Congratulations.  Glad to see you living your dream.  Enjoy the ride and send us reports.

thanx for the replies guys! i'll be sure to post lots of pictures of my experience...if you haven't figured out the link to Halley's through this website then you can find it at google if you just type in Halley's Camps...and hopefully I will have lots of entries for the tournament.  Till next time,  Hawk
